page.topic: Generating QR Codes on the Client-side Using Javascript
page.description: QR Codes are simply data. As with other data controls, you can the setValueFrom() to set the value of a QR Code.

section.title: Setting a URL in a QR Code
section.description: To see a video explanation of this example watch [this video].

step.description: In the UX Builder on the UX Controls page open the 'Data Controls' menu and click on the [TextBox] option to add a textbox control to the component. Set the textbox name and label to read 'code'.
Open the Containers menu and click on the [Frame] option to add a frame container.
Highlight the Frame container and go back to the Data Controls menu. Click on the [QRCode] option to add a QR code inside the frame. Give it the name and label 'qrcode'.
Highlight the QR Code control. Open the 'Other Controls' menu and click the [Button] option to add a button underneath the QR Code control.
In the properties list under 'Button Properties' change the Button text to read 'Set QR Code'.
Scroll down the buttons properties list to the 'Javascript' section. Click the [...] button next to the onClick property.
Click the 'Text mode' radio button and add the following javascript. Then click 'Save'.
Run the component in Live Preview. Enter a URL into the Code textbox and click the 'Set QR Code' button. you should see the QR Code change to incorporate the new data.
Scan the QR Code using QR Code on a phone using a QR code Reader, this should take you to the set url.
